results.title: The Mole and the chewing gum
results.creator_credit: J. Forman, H. Mauricova, H. Kilianove, Kratky Film and Zdenek Miler
results.brief_description: An animated film about a mole who discovers some chewing gum and gets into a sticky situation. Story by J. A. Novotny. Music by Milos Vacek. Animated by J. Doubrava, O. Kudrnac, K. Stebl, V. Maresova, Z. Bartova and J. Vokoun.

results.title: The Mole and the camera
results.creator_credit: J Sebestik, Kratky Film and Zdenek Miler
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film about a mole whose new camera is broken during a fight with his friend Mouse. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Mole and the bulldozer
results.brief_description: An animated film about a mole tending his flowerbeds only to find surveyors stakes marking a projected road. When he sees a bulldozer approaching, the mole quickly devises a plan to outwit the bulldozer and save his garden.
results.description: An animated film about a mole tending his flowerbeds only to find surveyors stakes marking a projected road. When he sees a bulldozer approaching, the mole quickly devises a plan to outwit the bulldozer and save his garden.

results.title: The Mole and music (K)
results.brief_description: Mole is a music-lover. When he breaks a record that he is especially fond of, he does not just sit and mope, but with the help of Mouse sets out to make a new record from scratch. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Mohammedan world: beginnings and growth
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and John Smart
results.brief_description: Presents scenes of mosques and historic landmarks in cities which are a part of the Mohammedan world; life in Baghdad, Damascus, Cairo and Old Jerusalem; discusses Mohammedanism and traces its development; shows the contribution of Mohammedans to western culture in literature, agriculture, chemistry, mathematics and the industrial arts.

results.title: The Modern prospector
results.creator_credit: Tim Wilson, ONF | NFB and Jean-Yves Bigras
results.brief_description: Instead of pick and shovel, the modern prospector employs all the resources of science to look for buried treasure. Aerial surveys, airborne magnetometers, instruments to measure the breadth and depth of ore bodies - with these the prospector can provide data to the company geologist to pinpoint the most promising drilling locations.

results.title: The Modern lithographer
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the techniques of lithographic artists, and the process of duplicating black and white originals by means of direct and offset lithography. The roles of the commercial photographer and the modern printing press in the mass production of attractive art prints, including advertising materials, are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Modern infantryman
results.brief_description: Illustrates the role of the infantryman in the modern army. Shows his training in the use of weapons and in tactics, illustrates the three types of battle dress adapted to meet the demands of different climates. The weapons shown include the .303 rifle, light and medium machine gun, flame throwers, hand grenades and anti-tank weapons. Today, the infantry has taken to the air and infantrymen are being trained to become members of paratroop units.

results.title: The Modern electric refrigerator. Part 1. The How and why of refrigeration
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, Merton Park, Film Producers Guild and David Cons
results.brief_description: Describes the nature of food and explains how heat acts to cause decay and cold acts as a preservative. Explains three main processes of refrigeration - evaporation, pressure and condensation, and how these function in a sealed unit. Shows how to pack food for maximum efficiency and air circulation. Gives advice on defrosting, cleaning and care.
